name: CBL & Associates Properties, Inc.
description: CBL & Associates Properties, Inc. is a leading real estate investment trust (REIT) specializing in the ownership, development, and management of retail properties across the United States. Founded in 1988 and headquartered in Chattanooga, Tennessee, CBL focuses on shopping centers and malls, positioning itself as a prominent player in the retail real estate sector. The company owns and manages a diverse portfolio of properties, including regional malls, outlet centers, and community shopping centers. CBL's mission is to enhance the shopping experience by creating vibrant retail environments that attract a wide range of tenants and customers. The company is dedicated to maintaining high occupancy rates and adapting to the evolving retail landscape, which includes the integration of e-commerce strategies and experiential retail. CBL is committed to sustainability and community engagement, working closely with local businesses and stakeholders to drive economic growth. With a strategic approach to property management and a focus on innovation, CBL aims to deliver long-term value to its shareholders while fostering thriving retail destinations.

seo.meta_title: CBL & Associates Properties, Inc. | Leading Retail REIT
seo.meta_description: Explore CBL & Associates Properties, Inc., a top real estate investment trust specializing in retail properties. Discover our portfolio, mission, and commitment to innovation.

faq.question: What does CBL & Associates Properties, Inc. do?
faq.answer: CBL & Associates Properties, Inc. specializes in the ownership, development, and management of retail properties across the United States.

faq.question: Who is the CEO of CBL?
faq.answer: Stephen Lebovitz is the CEO of CBL & Associates Properties, Inc.

faq.question: Where is CBL headquartered?
faq.answer: CBL is headquartered in Chattanooga, Tennessee, USA.

faq.question: What types of properties does CBL manage?
faq.answer: CBL manages regional malls, outlet centers, and community shopping centers.
